question.text: For plane electromagnetic waves propagating in the <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>+</mo><mi>z</mi></math>-direction, which one of the following combinations gives the correct possible direction for <math><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover></math> and <math><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover></math> field respectively?

options.text: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mover accent="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mover accent="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mover accent="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">j</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mover accent="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mover accent="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>3</mn><mover accent="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mover accent="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mover accent="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mover accent="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mover accent="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mover accent="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>3</mn><mover accent="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mover accent="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>4</mn><mover accent="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mover accent="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></mrow></mfenced></math>

solution.text:
The direction of propagation of the electromagnetic waves is along E→×B→.

Also E→·B→=0

When E→ is along -2 i^-3 j^

And B→ is along 3 i^-2 j^

Then E→×B→=-2i^-3j^×3i^-2j^

=4 k^+9 k^

=13 k^ is along +ve direction also E→·B→=0
